column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

The supply of cattle increase by 200 for a yarding of 2980 head in a Combined Prime and Store sale. Quality was very mixed comprising of some good lines of prime bullocks heifers and cows, one large line of northern cows an increased number of northern bulls and mixed quality lines of steers and heifers. All regular buyers were in attendance along with one central feeder, one live exporter and opportunity backgrounders and restockers. Cattle were drawn from Mt Isa, Normanton, Croydon, Georgetown, Richmond, Belyando,
local and coastal areas.

Demand was firm for most classes, however poor quality types struggled to attract buyer interest, with values reflective of quality and weight. Grown steers were firm to 15c better, cows lifted 2c to 6c, bullocks increased 4c and heavy bulls averaged 15c better.

Light suitably weaned steers returning to the paddock sold to 284c, similar heifers reached 266c to average 250c and processor heifers sold to 220c, most at 210c/kg. Yearling steers above 200kg to backgrounders reached 274c to average 230c/kg.  Steers above 280kg to feed made to 290c and those above 330kg sold to 286c to average 274c/kg. Steers suitable for live export averaged 285c/kg. Yearling heifers above 280kg to feed averaged 257c and heifers above 330kg sold to 276c to average 271c/kg..

Grown steers above 400kg to live export sold to 299c to average 296c, steers to the trade sold to 298c to average 284c/kg. Grown steers above 500kg to live export reached 310c, processor types averaged 315c selling to 322c/kg. A good supply of grown heifers to the trade sold to 272c, averaging 267c/kg.

A mixed offering of heavy full mouthed bullocks to export slaughter topped at 324c, better quality types averaging 294c to 318c/kg. More than 1,100 cows were penned, with strong demand throughout. Lightweight 2 score cows to feed reached 232c to average 226c, cows to processors sold to 244c to average 211c/kg. Medium weight 3 score cows sold to 266c to average 250c, a small number of prime heavyweight cows topped at 268c to average 265c/kg. Heavy bulls to live export sold to 298c most sales from 268c to 282c/kg. Heavy bulls to processors reached 296c, averaging 241c to 282c/kg.

Market Reporter, Mick Kingham
